title: 112_hr4165
content: The Act titled "CT Colonography Screening for Colorectal Cancer Act of 2012" allows for coverage of computed tomography colonography screening as a colorectal cancer screening test under Medicare. The Act "CT Colonography Screening for Colorectal Cancer Act of 2012" amends the Social Security Act to include screening computed tomography colonography as a colorectal cancer screening test under Medicare. Payment for this test will be consistent with payment for similar services under section 1848. Payment for screening computed tomography colonography under Medicare shall not exceed a specified amount based on recognized rates for diagnostic computed tomography colonography. For individuals receiving this screening, coinsurance will be calculated based on the fee schedule for the services provided. No payment under Medicare for colorectal cancer screening test if individual under 50 years or within 23 months of previous screening computed tomography colonography or colonoscopy. No payment under Medicare for colorectal cancer screening test if individual under 50 years or within 23 months of previous screening computed tomography colonography or colonoscopy. Conforming frequency limits for other colorectal cancer screening tests include screening flexible sigmoidoscopy and screening colonoscopy. Amendments allow for screening computed tomography colonography after previous screening flexible sigmoidoscopy. Amendments to Medicare coverage for colorectal cancer screening tests include adding screening computed tomography colonography as an option after previous screenings. Effective date for these changes is January 1, 2013. The amendment to the Social Security Act adds screening computed tomography colonography as a covered service under Medicare, effective January 1, 2013. Additionally, reports on the status of covering computed tomography colonography as a colorectal cancer screening test under Medicare are required. The Secretary of Health and Human Services must provide a preliminary report to Congress within 90 days of the enactment of the Act on the coverage of computed tomography colonography as a colorectal cancer screening test under Medicare. An annual report must also be submitted to Congress each fiscal year for five years, detailing the impact of screening computed tomography colonography on Medicare beneficiaries' colorectal cancer screening compliance and utilization rates. The utilization rates of colorectal cancer screening options for Medicare beneficiaries, including initial and follow-on screenings, are to be reported before and after the availability of computed tomography colonography under Medicare. The report will also focus on access to this screening option, especially in rural areas. The report will include utilization rates of colorectal cancer screening options for Medicare beneficiaries, with a focus on access in rural areas and underserved populations. Recommendations for legislative and administrative actions to implement the screening benefit under Medicare will also be provided.
